7004362	优楼频螺聚落	優樓頻螺聚落	yōulóupínluó jùluò	Uruvilvā; Uruvelā	proper noun	地名	Place Name	佛教	Buddhism	古印度	Ancient India	\N	\N	Sanskrit equivalent: uruvilvā, Pali: uruvelā, Japanese: Urubinra. Uruvilvā miterally means 'great bank of sand' in Sanskrit. It is located near the Nairanjana River 尼連禪. The Bodhisattva practiced asceticism in Uruvilvā for six years (BL 'Uruvilvā'; FGDB '優樓頻螺聚落'). The Mahāparinibbānasutta 《遊行經》 describes the Buddha visiting to Uruvilvā 鬱鞞羅 (T 1, Scroll 2; Dīgha Nikāya 16).	7004362
